name: Rush Mushin
I need 6, you need 7.
description:
This is actually my most favorite iteration of Medtech fast advance.

Going to some 1 point agendas means that sometimes you only need to score two agendas using FA tricks, then scoring two Clone Retirements out of hand.

Switching to Mushin No Shin from SanSan City Grid lets you bluff/trick/gamble your way to victory. Mushin No Shin + GRNDL Refinery is LEGIT. You can gain 24 bucks for a lowly investment of 3.

Mental Health Clinic is also pretty good. I still don't have tournament experience with it, so I'm not sure how many people will go out of their way to trash it.

Shi.Kyu in this deck is, to me, a must.

I think the deck is pretty tight. It's fantastic, has a lot of play, and sometimes you just gain a whole boatload of money.

name: Paintbrush Girl
Kenma Beast Suite
description:
Tenma can get a lot of cash, fast - use it to get your rig going and/or use Retrieval Runs to install the beastliest breakers for free or recur Faerie if you're desperate.

Indexing rather than Maker's to better fit with available influence - once your rig is up you should have no problem getting in, so come back and grab the agendas you put on top.

I expect there will be hate on Public Terminal and Grifter but I find they fill out Tenma's economy nicely.

Wish there was room for a Vamp. Considering John Masanori x2 but not sure what I'd swap them with.

name: Andromeda's Setup
description:
Goal: Keep corp afraid of putting down remotes, try to force holding agendas in hand. DIsmantle remotes with FAO, parasite.

Then break into HQ w/ sneakdoor and HQ Interface once you have 3 points. Try not to disturb archives until you're ready.

Dyson Mem Chip feeds UW Contact and Overmind.

Feedback Filter as a Jinteki counter, I expect a heavy Jinteki presence in my meta.

What am I missing?

name: Keyhole Theory
Keyhole Theory
NBN Making News
I Got Dirt On You HP
description:
This deck is all about Blackmail. Using Activist Support to deal out Bad Publicity, New Angles in order to avoid the tag Activist gives you, and Aesops sells the Activist so you don't have to keep paying to avoid that tag.

After that point, you simply keep the corporation under control with blackmails. Never run a server with ICE without Blackmail, unless playing against Replicating Perfection. Use R&D Interfaces against Fast Advance.

This deck have been extremely successful, and although certain cards is a pretty hard counter, I rarely see them played at a competitive level.

name: Aggro Noise - Slow down FA
description:
The aim of the deck is to pressure every server!

parasite is used to destroy any slow str ice or problematic ice. I tend to focus on installing parasite on remotes (if you can destroy their remote then they have no way of scoring agends). Datasuckers are there to support parasite and for targeted milling. Reducing ice strength to support with icebreakers isnt that vital. Possibly could play x2 datasuckers if you wanted.

Imp and account siphon slow down fast advance/kill combos, either by trashing key parts or getting rid of cash + hemorrhage heaps when you are on a roll.

Cyber-feeders are to fuel the virus installs and help with the icebreakers. This is the MVP of the deck. Helps out a lot with economy but you could replace it with liberated accounts depending on your place style.

Same old thing + deja vu are for recurssion Everything these is pretty self explanatory. I rarely (almost never) have economy issues and the programs are just enough to apply pressure and targeted milling. I tend to target mil instead of freely installing a virus (even if that means not gaining that one extra virus token) but again depends how you like to use virus.

Why Noise and not Reina?

I would love to have the +1 Link, but the target milling makes you passively pressure every server which is great in slowing down FA.

name: Stealth Quest
description:
The plan is to assault the central servers quickly hoping to score with Maker's Eye or Legwork in the first few turns. Use your expose on the remotes to see if the unrezed cards are worth a Quest Completed.

For econ we are running casts over Kati as we wont have the extra clicks on the turns you are running.

The breaker suite is the new Alias/Breach/Passport suite plus a Femme and Crypsis for the late game.

I would like to test both Planned Assault and Early Bird but struggle to make cuts to keep it at 40.

name: Dragon Deck
Kit - Brushosaurus
description:
3-0 at recent Game Night event - Honor and Profit legal. Defeated HB Big Ice, Weyland Supermodernism, and Jinteki Personal Evolution.

Lots of Card draw and tutoring to mitigate the inconsistency of having so many 1 and 2 ofs, while also ensuring that I have the supporting pieces needed to make yogosaurus hum.

In the next build I think I'll be replacing the Mem Chip with a third R&D Interface so the deck can race FA easier. I didn't face a FA build and I'm not sure how it would have done.

Deck is very straightforward, and very powerful, I hope you enjoy it!

name: Stirling - No Country For Old Man
description:
The idea of a DLR deck with joshua B. / Masanori / NACH is far from new. What makes it good now is Ian unique ability. Mill deck don't plan to run often, but they usually suffer from a bad economy : removing tags is expensive, and that 's where Ian's ability shines.

As a combo deck, combo pieces are essentials, so this deck doesnt seek for long term efficiency. In that regard, Mr Li here is far superior from ProCon, because you want it early and prefere to keep your hostages for key cards if they dont show up.

how to play this deck :

1/ find combo pieces :

During this initial part of the game, you dont mind the corp scoring agendas. Sure, they will be ahead, but then your econ engine will be turned on, and your board should be overrun with ressources and connections. Mr Li is a staple here, mulligan for him. If you can, try to install DLR early on, usually from a single archive run.

2/ Alternate mill round and draw round.

With you combo on the board (DLR + Masanori), you can start milling 2 card per turn (run => jackout, DLR, DLR, remove tag).

2 cards milled for 2 cred and a full turn, that s not that impressive. Things only get better as you get Crash space, Joshua and NACH on the table. you re then able to mill 3 cards per turn, without spending a single credit.

Knowing when to mill and when to draw for overmind could be tricky, but having an overmind inplay, with E3 as support, means that no remote is safe anymore. With the source, protected with some fall guys, you should be able to know when the corp want to score. Having to pay 3 more to steal seems expensive, but the source really mess with your opponent gameplan.

3/ Prepare for the glory run

Game will usually go to corp being decked out, but if you opponent threat you on match point, you can go for the glory run on archives after milling 3 more cards !

name: Jinteki Death and Taxes
description:
Sundew + RSVP is a strong economic boon. Caprice, Snowflake, NAPD + RSVP very strong (hard to break) advancing remote.

I went 3-0 with this list at the recent Game Night event, beating Andromeda, Mac, and Noise. None of those decks could overcome my economic advantage, with the AP ice acting principally as rattlesnakes throughout most games.

I'm not sure where the obvious changes are, so I'll keep playing as-is and look for ways to modify and improve it. I'd love to read your feedback on it!

name: Friendteki
description:
Friendteki is your friend! We both win easier! Want some credits? Sure thing buddy, lets both have credits! Want some agenda points? Take my 4/2! I've got another couple and now they're even easier to score. Look, I can even put this lovely obvious agenda right here on the table for you! I mean, I have to ice it, but as any friend would tell you; anything worth doing is worth doing right.

Have you met my friend Caprice? She's great on the SanSan club scene. You should come out with us some time.

name: JinKil Age
description:
This deck is pre-H&P and is a concept i have been playing around with for a very long time.

The deck provides a great balance between asset and operation kill combo pressure.

I use restructure for the big burst, but subliminal messaging is almost just as good and is great at hiding information.

Post H&P, Agends will be shifted around and same with a Ice.

name: Agro Kitty
description:
This is my version of Kit.

It combos Yogasaurus and Cypher with atman and Omega for deeper ice.

name: Baby Got Brain
description:
Half-assed parody time? Half-assed parody time!

I like big rigs and I can not lie

You other runners can't deny

That when a girl runs in with an over-powered mind

And breaks past ICE of every kind

You get sprung, wanna pull out your tough

'Cause you notice that mind was stuffed

With all the mem she's rigging

I'm hooked and I can't stop digging

Oh baby, I wanna run wit' ya

And steal their agenda

My anarchs tried to prevent me

But that mind you got made me run sentries

Ooh, bunch-o'-mem-chips

You say you drawin' for more in grip?

Well, use it, use it

'Cause that ain't the average run kit

I've seen them breakin'

To hell with suite makin'

It's digs, big

Got it runnin' like a turbo 'rig

I'm tired of all the rest

Sayin' full suites are the best

Take the average runner and ask him that

She gotta pack much brains

So, fellas! (Yeah!) Fellas! (Yeah!)

Has your runner got the mind? (Hell yeah!)

Tell 'em to run it! (Run it!) Run it! (Run it!)

Run that giant mind!

Baby got brain!

name: Weyland: Because We Built It
Iain Sterling - Criminal Network v1.2a
description:
ALTERNATE VARIANT:

This build is a slight modification of the v1.2 deck which replaces the Rabbit Holes and Compromised Employees with another Borrowed Satellite and Decoys. I also swapped out Tri-Maf for Mr. Li to help improve draw speed.

name: Deck of Knives V2
HB Ambush
description:
I’m guessing I’m not the first person to think of this, but with the release Mushin No Shin I though I’d test out a HB ambush deck. The idea is any card you advance (or especially Mushin No Shin) could be a Mandatory Upgrades which opens options. Plus you know the idea of scoring a Mandatory Upgrades in two turns for 3 creds just seemed like something I’d like to try ;)

Anyway this deck is very much a rough draft at this point and any opinions on how to spend the remaining influence, change the ice mix or change to the deck in general are welcome.

name: Overmind Kasparov v3
rojo control
Medtech
Yeah, I Capstone...
description: This is a super fun shaper deck that actually makes Capstone as good if not better than diesel. The idea here is to have a huge MU to host tons of programs, all of which include at least two copies of each with accompanying resources for econ. In the mid game you can really tutor quickly by capstoning with at least 2 (though frequently 3) cards you already have installed. Cloak, Dagger, and Silencer ensure that you can face check most things early as you build your rig, while paintbrush pairs nicely with any of the three breakers featured, and with no shortage of ways to make money you can amass quite a bank account to hack almost any server. This is a tried and true shaper deck that shows a normal shaper early game but accelerates quickly in the mid game. Sure it could replace a few things or add SMC, but I find a lot of the tutoring cards take away from Mac's ability. Capstone can be really fast and cheap producing a faster draw rate than a drawn diesel. After playing with this deck a bunch I have come to the conclusion that Capstone is a very under-rated shaper card.

name: Darman, Atman and Darwin in Anarch
description: I've never played an Atman deck, and I wanted to give it a try. Rather than do the normal Shaper version, I thought I'd give an Anarch version a try, given that that's where most of the support comes from, and it's my preferred faction. An Atman at 3, 4 or 5, supported by a Darwin for smaller ICE, should get me into most servers. Masanori for draw, Mimic for Swordsman, Keyhole + Medium is the main win con. Whizzard might be a better call in your meta.

name: Aggressive Keyhole
description:
My next attempt at a high-pressure Anarch deck. The standard Anarch breaker set supported by an Atman allows for cheap runs on R&D for repeated Keyholing. A lot of people disagree, but I like Medium and Keyhole together. Keyhole to charge Medium, alternate the two after that to see more cards. It also means you're not dead in the water after a virus wipe.

Account Siphon slows the corp down, and allows me to pressure HQ. I'd like to get some Same Old Things in there, but I'm not sure if it's worth it.

Chakana is the reason why i don't run 3x AC. Being able to slow down Fast Advance is a really nice boon.

I think John Masanori would be a good fit, but I'm not sure where to add him.

name: Weyland: Meat Cleaver v2
Ken Express
description: Leave your comments, experienced players ;) I say before you comment- I won't change Maker's Eye for interface, digging for something that I can't tutor is just too slow for this deck, I tested this option.

name: Never Leave Home Without a Knife v0.2
description:
Taking the core of the Dagger-Brush archetype, and applying it to this enigma of a runner. Nasir loves to facecheck, and the Dagger build allows you to do so safely. With so many recurring credits, you shouldn't have any issues with losing your credit pool. The non-killer breakers both maintain strength throughout the run, so that makes you more flexible with where you spend your money, too.

Personal Workshop seems like an auto-include with Nasir. Pheromones could be a fantastic source of free money for PW, or it could be a dud. Needs testing. Imp lets you trash even if you arrive without cash.

ProCo is also perfect for Nasir. Most runners find it to be a huge tempo loss if dropped first turn. Not him. Drop it, facecheck your way to riches! It's also the perfect economy card, as it allows you to dig up all the cards you want to put in Workshops.

I'd love to find room for a Stimhack or two, if only for the PW synergy. Escher is just as situational here as it is anywhere else, and I'm not sold on Tinkering, but this deck is untested, what with Nasir being unreleased and all. I just find him fascinating.

name: World of Andy
description: Worlds Andy deck - 2013

name: Yawn
description: Typical TWIY .. dated now.

name: Fortress America
description: Needs to be updated for Honor and Profit and recent packs. Concept is sound.

name: Johnny Quest
description: The goal of this deck is to be able to make runs consistently on centrals and then play Quest to access cards you know are agendas because you exposed them.

name: Stirling's Reputation
description: A big-rig deck with 23 Connections in it to capitalize on Calling in Favors. It plays more like a Shaper deck than a Criminal deck - the strategy is to build up a giant rig and use it to seize control of the entire table.

name: Psi-Teki Deception
description:
This deck has been surprisingly successful in OCTGN play. I don't think it's perfect yet, but I think it poses a lot of opportunities to take advantage of the Nisei ID and running at a reasonably low econ for most of the game.

While there isn't a ton of ETR Ice, three NAPDs and 2 TFPs make Rnd and HQ runs decently secure, as long as the run itself taxes credits.

You basically start by icing up centrals, then bluff out psi fields, mental health clinics or whatever you want with Mushin. GRNDL refinery and Ronin are there to punish the runner for not hitting your other Mushin No Shin bluffs. If an advanced card is doing nothing for you, you can Trick of Light the tokens to something useful and score it quickly. Cerebral Overwriter was the choice here over Junebug as Deus X, Netshield, Feedback Filter and Plascrete all see more play. Furthermore, even one with advancement tokens that has been exposed becomes useful when you can whirlpool them into a bullfrog and force them into it.

Pay attention to their credit and resource position and use cerebral casts where appropriate. If the board state is right, you can easily force the runner to take the brain damage. If they don't take it, CA is there to punish them while you trash any valuable resources on the board. While this deck isn't built to flatline, the brain damage potential puts them in range of ronin, neural katana or a philotic entanglement.

Lastly, people may think Mental Health Clinic is a weird choice when brain damage is the core damage method of the deck. Thing is, not only are they good drip econ--the runner often forgets that a card is being contributed to their hand size. If their brain damage is high enough, you can trash and replace any clinics on the board and give them one turn to win the game ;). Sorry braindead Runners, your insurance is up.

Looking for any feedback on this build! Excited about the development of Nisei!

name: *Terms of Service
The Quest for the Notorious Shadow
description:
Essentially a central server cracker with a combo with Silhouette's ability and Quest Completed, also taking Notoriety along for the ride.

Run regularly on centrals, and with a Doppleganger out you maybe able to score multiple Quests/Notoriety in a turn.

name: Iain Sterling - Criminal Network v1.3
description:
The events in this deck are strictly for economy and tutoring. My desire was to do the Criminal thing differently, so none of the usual event tricks are included.

The Helpful AI can be tutored with Hostage to make sure Underworld Contacts are providing credits ASAP. Calling In Favors is intended for the mid-to-late game to provide powerful burst economy for runs when you have your network up and running.

Get your breakers into place ASAP and put pressure on the central servers using the Interfaces.

name: Tennin Instithunder
description: Use cheap damagey ice to discourage runs, Caprice to end runs, get free counters, trick some lights, score agendas.

name: Iain Thundering
description: No non-central icebreakers! Under ideal conditions don't score any agendas until you start using Keyhole and get enough agendas in the archives to win. Inside Job and Legwork are there to score agendas from other servers if necessary.

name: HB 1.0
description: Glacial Advance

name: Anarch, back to basics
Noise.01
The Express Train
description: Fairly self-explanatory agressive criminal brew. Nothing special for a criminal deck, but now we have 17 influence, which allows us to play that extra Maker's Eye or whatever plus Ken pays you for every Dirty Laundry, Indexing, Inside Job, etc. With Prepaid VoicePAD and Desperado all of these things are virtually for free. With Sneakdoor we get into HQ even when the Corp. puts thousands of Ice in front of it. Icebreakers plus Datasucker are also self-explanatory. Have fun!

name: Black Girl Power
Stop Exposing Yourself
description:
Blackguard/ Expose deck designed to keep the Corp as broke as possible.

I think my economy is weak and I'd rather run with a 40 card deck including a Levy AR.

name: Hot Mess
description: I'm just trying to disrupt the corporation anyway I can. Ideally I'd siphon and use nerve agent early game to pressure HQ. When that is blocked off, I pull out the medium and lock down R&D. The Source is mainly to slow down FA. I'm torn between Hemorrhage, Imp, and Keyhole against operation-based decks. I can tutor for Hemorrhage and Imp, but Keyhole would be useful to turn over R&D after a medium access.

name: The Slow Advance
description:
I first saw the decktype watching one of Apreche's videos, and instantly loved it. The basic concept is to sit tight and advance things for a long long time, preferably using Simone Diego to do it for free. Back then it also used Matrix Analyzer etc. to do funky stuff, but recently I've found that there is simply too much I want in the deck to keep them, and since Simone is integral to the design, a lot of influence is already used up by her.

The basic principal is to install something and advance it twice. Next turn you install something (to get your free credit) or whatever you feel like and advance the previous card twice again. And again. And again. Until you either score it, make a ton of cash or install something over it. If Simone is out, sometimes it's even worth it to keep advancing a "failed" trap just to establish the routine of keep advancing the cards.

The deck has a lot of leeway for personal touches. Currently I'm testing out the GRNDL Refinery, and Corporate Troubleshooter in the deck and am quite happy with them. Especially the troubleshooter as you often sit on a pile of creds.

Scoring a Mandatory Upgrades is obviously good, but overscoring Project Ares is incredible. If you get off to a good start, Project Ares can almost reset the runner, and you can build up another one while he or she establishes themselves again. Overscoring Vitruvius is obviously also really good. Allows you to use the counters in a Jackson way (using the Archives as a resting spot of agendas), recurring whatever you need the most. Lost ICE, money boosts etc.

The ICE selection is based on ETR, taxing and Atman-proof. Guess the basics of the deck was constructed when Atman was high. This can easily be changed according to local meta or preferance - but you want to have your remote somewhat taxing to go through, as well as your R&D. Sometimes also HQ, depending on how vulnerable you feel.

H&P Update: Removed 1x Simone Diego and 1x GRNDL Refinery Added 2x NeoTokyo Grid

The GRNDL Ref gave a huge econ boost if you got it through, but the NeoTokyo is kinda like a weaker but cheaper Simone that is harder to trash and also works together with Simone for even more synergy. There are still plenty of advanceable non-Agendas.

name: Wayland Rush Down
description: A single server deck built for massive cash flow, just keep the runner out while you score away no subtlety required and the odd snare to punish them on R&D / HQ runs.

name: Sonic the Grifter
My Kit Deck
Operation Overmind
description: my version of the high MU overmind recursion deck thats going around

name: Exiled Overmind
description:
Just a fun deck with a simple idea - play Overmind as your "only" breaker/installed program (3 power counters, or 4 when installed on Omni-Drive) and try and make it more efficient with the e3FeedBack Implants. Once your Overmind is out of power, pawn it to Aesop's or Scavenge for itself for extra buttkicking for goodness.

Grappling Hook there for the obvious synergy with e3, and Deus X/Sharpshooter cause they're great disposable breakers...

( ??? Chaos Theory loves Overmind Deck ??? - might try her instead of Exile )

(Thanks to @nervamory for extra inspiration with his "Overmind Kasparov v2")

name: Terrible Combos are Terrible
description: Hello Portal my old friend. I've come to talk with you again.

name: Chaos Theory - Overmind
description: The Toolbox = Astrolabe Mass Install = Trade-In

name: Overmind Kate
description:
So this is a Overmind/Grappling Hook recursion deck. Between those two breakers and E3 Feedback Implants, nothing keeps you out. There's a copy of Mimic in there for Swordsman, and Inti to deal with Wraparound.

Economy is Kati+Underworld Contact with some hardware supplementation from Inside Man (jury's still out on his presence in this deck) and Modded. Lots of out-of-hand econ too with Lucky Find & Dirty Laundry, although I may swap the latter out for Sure Gambles instead.

The thing I heard about Overmind decks was that they're pricey to run, but this deck does a lot with very little money. Bigger ICE is dealt with via grappling hook plus a few credits from E3. The rest is Overmind (which is free if you Modded it in with Kate's discount). The recurring credits on Toolbox go a long way, as does free money every turn via Underworld Contact.

Clone Chips, and Test Runs let you recycle where needed. When an overmind is empty, Scavenge is your best friend for refreshing tokens. Aesop's + a Clone Chip is good too, though try and save your clone chips for Grappling Hook if you see a bigger piece of ICE over R&D.

The whole affair can take a bit to get going, but is pretty great once it has a bit of momentum.

name: Brain No Shin
description: This deck is hilarious to play. not sure how competitive. to land 6 brain damage is a beautiful thing
